variants.Description in input context: L166P (severe structural destabilization), E64D (no structural perturbation), M26I, A104T, D149A

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Solution-state NMR and Circular Dichroism (CD) spectroscopy

Material used.Material Name: DJ-1 mutants (L166P, E64D, M26I, A104T, D149A) and wild-type DJ-1
Material used.Description: Structural and thermodynamic analysis of DJ-1 variants compared to wild-type protein.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Complete loss-of-function (severe structural destabilization and thermodynamic disruption)
Readout description.Result Description: L166P caused severe structural destabilization and thermodynamic disruption compared to wild-type DJ-1.
E64D showed no significant structural or thermodynamic perturbation compared to wild-type DJ-1.
M26I exhibited moderate structural and thermodynamic alterations, though less severe than L166P.
A104T showed moderate structural and thermodynamic changes compared to wild-type.
D149A exhibited moderate structural and thermodynamic alterations, though less severe than L166P.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Structural/thermodynamic parameters similar to wild-type DJ-1 (custom threshold)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant structural/thermodynamic deviations from wild-type (custom threshold)
